extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb Peeled and deveined Gulf shrimp

title: Spicy Thai Grilled Shrimp
summary: Spicy Thai Grilled Shrimp might be just the Asian recipe you are searching for. This recipe makes 2 servings with 569 calories, 47g of protein, and 39g of fat each. For $5.52 per serving, this recipe covers 25% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 15 people were glad they tried this recipe. It works well as a main course. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. If you have cilantro, garlic, sugar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is solid. Try Grilled Shrimp Thai Salad with a Spicy Peanut Dressing, Spicy Thai Shrimp Salad, and Spicy Thai Shrimp Wraps for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Directions1Mix the hot sauce, Worchestire, oil, cilantro, sugar and garlic in a glass bowl large enough to hold the shrimp.2Add the shrimp to the bowl and place in the refrigerator.3Allow the shrimp to marinate for 1 - 2 hours. The longer the time, the spicier the shrimp, but don't go past 2 hours.4Preheat the grill to medium-high.5While the grill heats up, skewer the marinated shrimp.6Grill the marinated shrimp skewers for about 3 minutes per side. Be careful not to over-cook the shrimp, they are done once they turn opaque.

steps.step: Mix the hot sauce, Worchestire, oil, cilantro, sugar and garlic in a glass bowl large enough to hold the shrimp.2

Add the shrimp to the bowl and place in the refrigerator.3Allow the shrimp to marinate for 1 - 2 hours. The longer the time, the spicier the shrimp, but don't go past 2 hours.4Preheat the grill to medium-high.5While the grill heats up, skewer the marinated shrimp.6Grill the marinated shrimp skewers for about 3 minutes per side. Be careful not to over-cook the shrimp, they are done once they turn opaque.
